I guess Joe Rainsberger's reply has a value point.  Using a search
engine certainly brings up a lot but not necessarily the most accurate
information.  It is tempting to answer a question with a reference to a
search engine but no one can guarantee what shows up in a day, a week,
or any time.

 

I don't have a list of online references for best practices available.
Maybe a look at the JUnit FAQ might help to find more information?
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests.  

 

There is also a very good book available, and since the author does not
mention it, I take the freedom to do it: JUnit Recipes
http://www.manning.com/rainsberger/.

 

 

Andreas

 

________________________________

Subject: Re: [junit] Guidelines/Best Practices for writing JUnit Test
cases

I read the first hit article. It had so many errors in it, I got sick.
